intro: Artemisia gallica subsp. maroccana, commonly known as Moroccan wormwood, is a perennial herb native to North Africa. It is characterized by its aromatic, silver-gray foliage and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in Mediterranean climates. It has a strong, camphor-like scent and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Its adaptability makes it a hardy plant suitable for xeriscaping and ornamental gardening.
